Articles.Content:
DELETE ME

**Edited <time datetime="2021-12-15T07:18:43Z" title="12/15/2021 07:18  AM" data-short="2 yr">December 15, 2021</time> by rdude71**
  
DELETE ME
Coming in at a shallow angle will help a lot. Try aiming for a 20km periapsis when re entering and try keep high up around 20-30km while bleeding of speed.

The heat shield are for pods it's true, though if you're re-entering carefully enough you'll be okay, spaceplanes have to rely on their built-in heat tolerances ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Use the new air brakes or the new drogue chutes to slow down during your descent. The drogue chutes even stay attached once you hit the runway and only disappear after you come to full stop.

Yeah, you'll need to go a bit slower than normal now. Try to hit the 40-35 km range on reentry and you should be golden. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Come in belly first, like the Shuttle did.
